title: PHYSICAL APPEARANCE
description: The PHYSICAL APPEARANCE contains the attributes that describe the appearance of a tangible item.

depth.title: depth
depth.description: Depth is one dimension of a three dimensional tangible item. It is the dimension describing the distance from the tangible item's front to its back. Generally, tangible items have a depth (1). For some objects, e.g. Lyophilisates, the dimension is not relevant (0).

externalDiameter.title: externalDiameter
externalDiameter.description:
External diameter is the diameter of the outer boundary of a round item.
External Diameter is relevant for round tangible items (1), for which dimensions Width and Depth are not maintained, as the calculation of Volume from Hight x Width x Depth would generate wrong values. For rectangulare tangible items, External Diameter is not maintained (0).

height.title: height
height.description: Height is one dimension of a three dimensional tangible item. It is the dimension describing the distance from the tangible item's bottom to its top. Generally, tangible items have a hight (1). For some objects, e.g. Lyophilisates, the dimension is not relevant (0).

imprintBottomSide.title: imprintBottomSide
imprintBottomSide.description: Some tangible items carry an imprint (1), some do not (0). Imprints may occur at the bottom and/or at the top of the item. This attribute documents the Imprint on the bottom side of the tangible item.

imprintTopSide.title: imprintTopSide
imprintTopSide.description: Some tangible items carry an imprint (1), some do not (0). Imprints may occur at the bottom and/or at the top of the item. This attribute documents the Imprint on the top side of the tangible item.

shape.title: shape
shape.description: Shape is a values of a basic form describing a tangible item to a limited level of detail.

weight.title: weight
weight.description:
The Gross Weight is the weight of the item including goods and packaging. A gross weight may also be called just weight.
If Weight is maintained in PHYSICAL APPEARANCE, then a UNIT OF MEASURE has to be maintained (1).
If Weight is not maintained in PHYSICAL APPEARANCE, then no UNIT OF MEASURE has to be maintained (0).

width.title: width
width.description:
Replaced by Length.
Width is one dimension of a three dimensional tangible item. It is the dimension describing the distance from the tangible item's left to its right. Generally, tangible items have a width (1). For some objects, e.g. Lyophilisates, the dimension is not relevant (0).

colorBottomSideSapCode.title: colorBottomSide.sapCode
colorBottomSideSapCode.description: The SAP Code is the unique identifier from SAP to identify the data record for COLOR.

colorBottomSideCode.title: colorBottomSide.code
colorBottomSideCode.description:
The SAP Code is the unique identifier from SAP to identify the data record for COLOR.
This element is deprecated and will be removed soon.
Please use sapCode instead.

colorBottomSideRefId.title: colorBottomSide.referenceDataId
colorBottomSideRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

colorTopSideSapCode.description: The SAP Code is the unique identifier from SAP to identify the data record for COLOR.

volumeNominal.title: nominalVolume.nominalVolume
volumeNominal.description: The Nominal Volume is the volume that a container is designed to hold, leaving a defined volume of headspace in the container. With that, the Nominal Volume is smaller than the Maximum Volume, which is the maximum volume a container can hold, leaving no headspace volume.

volumeUomCode.title: nominalVolume.unitOfMeasure.sapCode
volumeUomCode.description:
The unconverted Code in Column MSEHI of SAP table T006.
This element is deprecated and will be removed soon.
Please use *SapCode instead.
